ResourceCriteria and PageCriteria are meant to be used to simplify resource fetching. 

<p>
<meta content="text/html; charset=utf-8" http-equiv="content-type">The ResourceCriteria works with $resources.list method and PageCriteria is for $pages.list method.  </meta>
</p>
<div lang="x-western" class="moz-text-html"><br />
<br />
<b>Example of resource fetching</b><br />
<br />
First, we need to have a criteria:<br />
<tt>#set($criteria = $apiTypes.createResourceCriteria())</tt><br />
<br />
Then we set some conditions in the criteria:<br />
<tt>$criteria.setPublished(true)<br />
$criteria.setParent($parentId)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &lt;-- the id of the parent folder</tt><br />
<br />
And sorting:<br />
<tt>$criteria.setSortField(&quot;title&quot;)<br />
$criteria.setSortOrder($enums.of(&quot;ccc.api.types.SortOrder&quot;, &quot;DESC&quot;))</tt><br />
<br />
<br />
Finally get the results (1=starting page, 20=items/page):<br />
<tt><span class="xml-text">#set($results = $pages.list($criteria,1,20))</span></tt><br />
<br />
<br />
The detailed list of options can be found from these JavaDocs. PageCriteria is an extension to the ResourceCriteria<br />
<br />
<a href="http://www.contentcontrol.com/javadoc/7.2.13/apidocs/ccc/api/core/ObjectFactory.html">http://www.contentcontrol.com/javadoc/7.2.13/apidocs/ccc/api/core/ObjectFactory.html</a><br />
<a href="http://www.contentcontrol.com/javadoc/7.2.13/apidocs/ccc/api/core/ResourceCriteria.html">http://www.contentcontrol.com/javadoc/7.2.13/apidocs/ccc/api/core/ResourceCriteria.html</a><br />
<a href="http://www.contentcontrol.com/javadoc/7.2.13/apidocs/ccc/api/core/PageCriteria.html">http://www.contentcontrol.com/javadoc/7.2.13/apidocs/ccc/api/core/PageCriteria.html</a></div>
